description: A medical marijuana caregiver in Mesa County, Colorado, who asked to not be identified, holds the top of one of his cannabis plants. His four-level warehouse acts as his home and business.   (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
With the state's approval, Matt cares for more than the five patient limit, growing what he says is just enough to provide medicine for each person.  (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)

Hoses are intertwined between Matt's cannabis plants, which he grows as a marijuana caregiver. He uses an industrial vacum to remove the excess water at the base of each pot.   (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
Matt waters one of many cannabis plants that he grows for patients on the Western Slope of Colorado. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
Matt uses poker chips at the base of each of his marijuana plants to help keep track of his watering schedule. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
Matt reties one of many ribbons that hold up his heavier, more mature marijuana plants. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
Because of Matt's location in Mesa County, which only has one dispensary, the state allows him to grow for more than the legal limit of five patients. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
With a background in mechanics, Matt designs and makes most of the equipment he uses to grow his medical marijuana. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
Matt lifts one of his cloned marijuana plants from its container to expose the growing root. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
Matt's dog looks up at her owner as he gets ready to go into his marijuana grow, where dogs aren't allowed. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
Matt holds a handful of compost which he stores outside in a warehouse, under a faded black tarp. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
Matt  uses solar energy to help with the cost of growing more than 60 cannabis plants for his patients. (Photo by Jessie Wardarski | News 21)
